column2: Everdelight, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am pleased with my experience with this drug.

column1: Mental Disorder with Loss of Normal Personality &amp; Reality
column9: I regret that the manufacture of this medication has ceased. I didn't prescribe it often, especially after release of the newer antipsychotics, but it is extremely valuable given its low side effect profile, especially low rate of weight gain (in my experience). I hope someone out there has the clout to persuade someone to resume manufacturing this drug.

column1: Mental Disorder with Loss of Normal Personality &amp; Reality
column2: nena, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Do Not take this medicine.  My mother took it for 8 months.  She is now permanently disabled.  She cannot eat or drink.  She has to have a feeding tube put in her for the rest of her life.  She has uncontrollable head and mouth movements.  Along with uncontrollable movements in her legs.  She is only 63 years old, and had been in good health.  She will never be the same again!!!

column9: this medication has done wonders for my son.but the manufactures have taken the higher mlgrms and discontinued. so he has to take 40 10 milagrahms tabs a day. he is 10 yo. n im trying to find a better way. but im affraid for him bcause he has been on every drug to treat this. literaly. any one have any ideas for me. plz...email me at taguirre1978@yahoo.com

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
13-18 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My teenage daughter as been taking Moban along with Topamax for a Bipolar Mood Disorder.  She has to take Cogentin to counter act the side effects.  However, this drug has done wonders for her and is a life saver!  She could not take Abilify either.  She had horrible side effects from it.  However, my husband takes Abilify without incident.

column1: Mental Disorder with Loss of Normal Personality &amp; Reality
column9: It works very well and I hope soon that they take abilify off the shelves...it nearly killed me...Moban is the very best drug for anxiety and paranoia...

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: nothing else completely stopped the delusions. Moban, though seldom perscribed anymore, has kept me out of the hospital for the last 12 years. I have to take it at night to avoid side effects.
